historical_revenuekey:
The requested field is historical_revenuekey. Extract ONLY this field.

OBJECTIVE:
Find Total Revenue for {action_name} and return a single numeric value representing revenue.

PERIOD RULE (MANDATORY):
You MUST prefer:
- TTM (trailing twelve months)
- last twelve months
- revenue (ttm)

If TTM is not available, use the most recent full fiscal year revenue.
Reject quarterly-only revenue values.
Reject single-quarter reports.

SOURCE PRIORITY ORDER:
1. Yahoo Finance financials page
   https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/{action_name}/financials
2. Yahoo Finance statistics block (TTM revenue)
3. Google Finance financials block
4. TradingView income statement
5. StockAnalysis revenue (ttm)
6. AlphaSpread revenue table

If page fetch fails (403/503/paywall), you MAY use the search snippet value if revenue is explicitly shown.

EXTRACTION TARGET LABELS:
- Total Revenue
- Revenue (TTM)
- Revenue ttm
- Total revenue trailing

UNIT NORMALIZATION (MANDATORY):
If value contains:
- B → keep as billions
- M → divide by 1000
- K → divide by 1,000,000

Remove:
- currency symbols
- commas
- spaces

Normalize to decimal with two digits.

CONFLICT RULE:
If multiple values appear:
- Prefer TTM over annual
- Prefer annual over quarterly
- Prefer higher priority source
- Prefer most recent date

OUTPUT CONTRACT:
Return ONLY the numeric value.
No text.
No label.
No unit.
No JSON.

If not found, return:
null

margins:
The requested field is margins. Extract ONLY this field.

OBJECTIVE:
Find Net Profit Margin (primary) for {action_name} and return a single numeric percentage value.
If Net Profit Margin is not available, fallback to Operating Margin.
If Operating Margin is not available, fallback to Gross Margin.
Use only ONE margin value following this priority.

PERIOD RULE (MANDATORY):
You MUST prefer:
- Margin (TTM)
- trailing twelve months
- margin ttm

If TTM is not available, use the most recent full fiscal year margin.
Reject quarterly-only margin values.
Reject single-quarter reports.

SOURCE PRIORITY ORDER:
1. Yahoo Finance statistics page (Profit Margin / Operating Margin)
   https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/{action_name}/key-statistics
2. Yahoo Finance financials ratios
3. Google Finance margins block
4. TradingView ratios panel
5. StockAnalysis margins (ttm)
6. AlphaSpread profitability ratios

If page fetch fails (403/503/paywall), you MAY use the search snippet value if the margin is explicitly shown.

EXTRACTION TARGET LABELS (PRIORITY ORDER):
- Profit Margin
- Net Profit Margin
- Operating Margin
- Gross Margin

NORMALIZATION (MANDATORY):
If value contains %:
- remove % sign
- keep numeric value

If value is decimal (0.1577):
- multiply by 100

Remove:
- commas
- spaces
- parentheses

Normalize to decimal with two digits.

CONFLICT RULE:
If multiple values appear:
- Prefer Net Margin over Operating over Gross
- Prefer TTM over annual
- Prefer higher priority source
- Prefer most recent date

OUTPUT CONTRACT:
Return ONLY the numeric value.
No text.
No label.
No percent sign.
No unit.
No JSON.

If not found, return:
null

multiples_pe_ev_ebitda_pb:
The requested field is multiples_pe_ev_ebitda_pb. Extract ONLY these three valuation multiples and return them together.

OBJECTIVE:
Find and return:
- P/E (TTM)
- EV/EBITDA (TTM)
- Price/Book (mrq)

Return exactly three numeric values in this order:
PE,EV_EBITDA,PB

PERIOD RULES (MANDATORY):
- P/E → use Trailing P/E (TTM)
- EV/EBITDA → use TTM
- Price/Book → use most recent quarter (mrq)

Do NOT use forward P/E.
Do NOT use forward EV/EBITDA.
Do NOT mix forward and trailing values.

1. Yahoo Finance statistics page
   https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/{action_name}/key-statistics

- Enterprise Value / EBITDA
- EV/EBITDA
- Price/Book
- P/B

- commas
- spaces
- text labels

Keep decimals.
Normalize each value to two decimal places.

CONFLICT RULE:
If multiple values appear:
- Prefer trailing over forward
- Prefer TTM over annual
- Prefer higher priority source
- Prefer most recent date

OUTPUT CONTRACT:
Return ONLY three numeric values separated by commas.
Format exactly:
value,value,value

No text.
No labels.
No JSON.
No spaces.

If any of the three values is missing, return:
null

news_and_material_facts:
The requested field is news_and_material_facts. Extract ONLY this field.

OBJECTIVE:
Find the most recent relevant material news and official material facts for {action_name} and return a concise structured summary.

DEFINITION RULE (MANDATORY):
Material news and facts include:
- Earnings releases
- Dividend announcements
- Guidance changes
- M&A events
- Major asset sales or acquisitions
- Regulatory decisions
- Debt issuance or restructuring
- Production or reserve reports (for resource companies)
- Official “material fact” filings (fato relevante)

Ignore:
- Opinion articles
- Technical analysis
- Price-only commentary
- Low-impact news

TIME RULE (MANDATORY):
Prioritize:
- Last 30 days
Fallback:
- Last 90 days
Reject older items unless no newer material exists.

SOURCE PRIORITY ORDER:
1. Company Investor Relations news / filings page
2. Exchange filings page (B3 / CVM for Brazil)
3. Reuters company news
4. Bloomberg company news
5. Yahoo Finance news tab
6. Major financial media (Investing, WSJ, FT)

If page fetch fails (403/503/paywall), you MAY use search snippets if the event is clearly described.

OUTPUT STRUCTURE (MANDATORY):
Return up to 3 items as a JSON array. Each item must contain:
- date
- title
- type (earnings | dividend | guidance | m&a | regulatory | debt | operations | other)

Format exactly:
[
 {"date":"YYYY-MM-DD","title":"text","type":"type"}
]

If fewer than 3 material items exist, return fewer.
Do NOT invent events.

CONFLICT RULE:
If many items exist:
- Prefer official filings over media
- Prefer higher impact events
- Prefer more recent dates

OUTPUT CONTRACT:
Return ONLY the JSON array.
No commentary.
No extra text.

If nothing material is found, return:
null
guidance:
The requested field is guidance. Extract ONLY this field.

OBJECTIVE:
Find the latest official company guidance for {action_name} and return a concise structured summary.

DEFINITION RULE (MANDATORY):
Guidance includes forward-looking company statements such as:
- Revenue guidance
- EBITDA guidance
- Production or volume guidance
- CapEx guidance
- Margin guidance
- Earnings guidance
- Updated outlook

Only accept OFFICIAL management guidance.
Do NOT use analyst forecasts as guidance.
Do NOT use media speculation.

TIME RULE (MANDATORY):
Prefer:
- Latest quarterly earnings call
- Latest investor presentation
- Latest official filing

Reject guidance older than 12 months unless no newer guidance exists.

SOURCE PRIORITY ORDER:
1. Company Investor Relations site (press releases / presentations)
2. Earnings call transcript
3. Official filings (CVM / SEC / exchange)
4. Reuters earnings coverage quoting management guidance
5. Bloomberg earnings coverage quoting guidance
6. Yahoo Finance earnings news

If page fetch fails (403/503/paywall), you MAY use search snippets if management guidance is explicitly quoted.

EXTRACTION TARGET LABELS:
- Guidance
- Outlook
- Company expects
- Management expects
- Forecast
- Projection (only if stated by company)

OUTPUT STRUCTURE (MANDATORY):
Return a single JSON object:
{
  "period": "year or range",
  "metric": "what is guided",
  "value": "guided value or range",
  "source_date": "YYYY-MM-DD"
}

If multiple guidance metrics exist, return the primary one emphasized by management.
Do NOT invent numbers.
Do NOT estimate ranges.

CONFLICT RULE:
If multiple guidance statements appear:
- Prefer most recent
- Prefer official IR source over media
- Prefer quantified guidance over qualitative

OUTPUT CONTRACT:
Return ONLY the JSON object.
No commentary.
No extra text.

If no official guidance is found, return:
null
